title: Ethereum's Ethscriptions: A Revolutionary Way To Create & Share Digital Artifacts - TronWeekly
content:
Middlemarch, a co-founder of NFT infrastructure Capsule 21, has recently unveiled an innovative Ethereum-based inscription system called Ethscriptions.

This new system allows users to create and share digital artifacts through Ethereum transaction call data, similar to Bitcoin inscriptions. Middlemarch has announced plans to open-source the indexer in the near future.

The announcement was made on Twitter, where Middlemarch expressed excitement about the launch of Ethscriptions. The tweet read, “Introducing Ethscriptions: a new way of creating and sharing digital artifacts on Ethereum using transaction calldata.”

Introducing Ethscriptions: a new way of creating and sharing digital artifacts on Ethereum using transaction calldata.https://t.co/XfQ7RdtblD



ALSO: Introducing Ethereum Punks. Because why should all non-contract Punk collecting happen on Bitcoin?https://t.co/d3Ycwbdc2Z… — Middlemarch (@dumbnamenumbers) June 16, 2023

Middlemarch also acknowledged the contributions of Michael Hirsch, the founder of Indelible_Labs, for helping build the front end and @duvtale for selecting the vibrant background color (#c3ff00).

Creating & Sharing Digital Artifacts On Ethereum With Ethscriptions

So how exactly do Ethscriptions work? The process is quite intriguing. Any successful Ethereum transaction that contains input data interpreted as a valid data URI can create an Ethscription as long as the data URI is unique. Duplicate content is automatically disregarded.

Furthermore, Ethscriptions support all valid mime-types, ensuring compatibility with a wide range of digital files.

To maintain uniqueness, an Ethscription’s content must not match that of any previous Ethscription from a previous block or a transaction within the same block.

It ensures that each Ethscription represents a distinct digital artifact. Additionally, any Ethereum transaction whose input data corresponds to the transaction hash of a valid Ethscription is considered a valid Ethscription transfer as long as the transaction’s sender is the Ethscription’s owner.

The recipient of the creation transaction determines the initial owner of an Ethscription, while the sender of the creation transaction is recognized as the Ethscription’s creator.

ethscriptions.com

According to the original site page providing information on Ethscriptions, getting started with this new system is relatively straightforward. Users can either utilize an easy creation tool available on the site or follow a step-by-step process.

To create an Ethscription manually, one can convert an image (with a maximum size of approximately 90KB) into a Base 64-encoded data URI using a service like base64-image.de.

Although Ethscriptions support all data URIs, images tend to yield the best results. The data URI should then be converted to hex using an online tool such as hexhero.

Finally, users can send a 0 ETH transaction to the desired recipient, including the hex data from the previous step in the “Hex data” field. Within a short period, the Ethscription should appear on the page, provided no one has already created an Ethscription with the same data. The system automatically filters out duplicate content.

However, as Middlemarch opens up the indexer to the public, it is expected to further empower artists and collectors in the world of NFTs, fostering creativity and innovation within the digital art community.

title: What is Neo? China's Ethereum Rival - Asia Crypto Today
content:
In an era where the digital economy is fast reshaping our understanding of finance and commerce, blockchain technology has surfaced as a pivotal innovator. Among the numerous platforms making strides in this space, NEO stands out, exhibiting a unique combination of technological advancements and forward-thinking economics. This guide delves into the heart of this dynamic platform, exploring its origins, distinctive features, security measures, dual-token system, and a plethora of benefits that make it a noteworthy player in the blockchain sphere.

Background

Emerging in 2014 under the moniker Antshares, the NEO project aimed to innovate and lay the foundations for the “smart economy”. This innovative vision was spearheaded by Da HongFei and Erik Zhang, who then introduced the initial coin offering for Antshares (ANS). In the duration of the ICO, the founders successfully amassed over 6,000 BTC.

In 2016, Antshares underwent a significant metamorphosis and reemerged as NEO, in a move that offered ANS token holders the opportunity to transition their assets into the reimagined currency. The term “NEO”, which derives from the Greek language, symbolizes something that is “new” or “young”. This terminology epitomizes the mission of the NEO project – to usher in a novel, advanced, and more efficient smart economy, boasting an impressive potential transaction processing rate of 10,000 transactions every second.

Announced in 2018, the Neo 3.0 protocol update is the next leap forward in the project’s development journey. This much-anticipated update was slated for official release in September 2021, symbolizing another important step towards realizing the project’s ambitious vision.

What is Neo?

NEO is a blockchain platform engineered to revolutionize asset and identity management by leveraging the power of smart contracts. The ultimate ambition is the realization of a fully-digitized, smart economy. In this futuristic economic model, digital identities and digital assets play a pivotal role in enhancing life quality for all individuals.

The unique strength of NEO lies in its aspiration to streamline digital asset management, utilizing the capabilities of smart contracts. Ultimately, it seeks to erect a decentralized, network-driven, smart economy infrastructure facilitated by an ecosystem of decentralized applications. The goal here is not only to digitize but also to automate, making transactions, interactions, and operations far more efficient and secure than ever before.

How is the Neo Blockchain Secured?

The NEO blockchain utilizes the Proof of Stake (PoS) consensus model alongside a distinctive protocol, delegated Byzantine Fault Tolerance (dBFT). This novel combination empowers NEO to process a vast number of transactions, reaching up to an impressive 10,000 transactions per second, while functioning across centrally endorsed nodes.

This hybrid of the PoS protocol and dBFT consensus mechanism furnishes NEO with the ability to scale its network effectively. It results in quicker transactions, smoother execution of smart contracts, and ease in the development of decentralized applications (Dapps).

The network supports two native tokens: NEO and GAS. NEO, which is indivisible, plays a central role in payment settlements on the platform and also has a significant role in network governance. NEO holders can stake their tokens to vote for consensus nodes. On the other hand, GAS, which is divisible up to 0.00000001, is utilized primarily for transaction fees. Consensus nodes, responsible for new block generation, receive rewards in GAS fees.

Furthermore, the protocol offers a unique toolset for developers in the form of NeoContracts. These smart contracts allow for the creation and development of Dapps, directly mirroring real-world products and services. An attractive feature of NeoContracts is their compatibility with widely recognized programming languages such as Java, providing developers an advantage by not requiring them to learn a new language for Dapp development. This unique aspect sets them apart from smart contract protocols used by other Dapp networks.

Exploring NEO’s Dual-Token System

A defining feature of NEO is its pioneering dual-token mechanism, making it the first public blockchain platform to separate network usage rights from governance rights. This also facilitates easy acquisition of the required tokens for transaction fees.

NEO

In the context of network governance, tokenholders are granted the privilege of voting for the Neo Committee. This committee consists of various members and consensus nodes that oversee the governance of the NEO blockchain. They are tasked with a variety of critical functions such as upholding the network’s liveliness and making necessary adjustments to vital blockchain parameters.

One unique characteristic of NEO tokens is their indivisibility – the minimum unit of NEO is 1. This indicates that transactions, such as withdrawals from exchanges to wallets, can only occur in whole numbers. As a result, NEO stands out as one of the scarcest public blockchain tokens since it cannot be fragmented into smaller units.

At the inception of the network, 100 million coins were produced, with roughly half reserved by the Foundation to stimulate the development of the NEO ecosystem.

GAS

GAS, the second token in NEO’s dual-token system, is utilized for operations and storage of tokens and smart contracts within the network. This practice prevents the misuse of node resources. System fees are destroyed, while network fees are redistributed amongst consensus nodes, offering an economic incentive for their contributions to the network.

The smallest unit of GAS is 0.00000001, and unlike some other networks, NEO doesn’t require staking to claim GAS tokens. The majority of Neo wallets include a claim function, enabling users to gather their GAS at the click of a button. It’s worth noting that some exchanges distribute GAS to users who hold NEO on their platform, while others don’t.

The lion’s share of GAS is disseminated to voters as a reward for their active involvement in network governance. Thus, NEO holders who wish to partake in this process should ensure they select a wallet that supports the voting function.

Advantages of Neo

NEO, an open-source blockchain, shares common traits with Ethereum and other platforms that allow developers to craft smart contracts and construct decentralized applications (dApps). With the initiation of a migration to a new version, N3, in 2021, NEO showcased a series of intriguing features, which include:

Multilingual Support: Aiming to be a developer-friendly blockchain, the protocol extends its support to various programming languages. The Neo Blockchain Toolkit, designed for creating blockchain applications, offers compatibility with C#, Python, Go, TypeScript, and Java.

Decentralized Storage: The distributed, decentralized storage network, known as NeoFS, is a unique feature of NEO. This system enables the encryption and secure storage of data.

Native Oracle: NEO boasts its own oracle service, allowing developers to tap into off-chain or external data sources. This unique feature adds a whole new level of versatility to the platform.

Self-sovereign Identity: The NeoID, a decentralized identity tool, allows for user authentication in blockchain-based applications. This offers users an extra layer of security and control over their digital identities.

Interoperability: As a founding member of Poly Network, an alliance designed to facilitate cross-blockchain transactions, NEO embodies true interoperability. This membership enables transactions across a myriad of networks, including Ethereum and BNB Chain, thus increasing the overall functionality and reach of the platform.

Conclusion

NEO serves as a beacon of innovation in the ever-evolving world of blockchain technology. Its commitment to creating a “smart economy”, coupled with its unique dual-token system and various other notable features, solidifies its position in the global blockchain ecosystem. NEO’s mission to support multiple languages, offer decentralized storage, and provide native oracle services is a testament to its inclusive and adaptable nature.

With the ongoing development and implementation of advanced features, NEO remains poised to usher in the future of digitized assets and identities, carving a path towards a more secure, efficient, and interconnected digital economy. Whether you’re a developer, investor, or a blockchain enthusiast, NEO’s offerings undeniably hold vast potential in the years to come.

title: Argent Wallet Review: Is This The Best Ethereum Wallet In 2023? - Blockzeit
content:
Argent Wallet is one of the latest trends in the diversified range of cryptocurrency wallets. The wallet solely helps users who only operate on the Ethereum blockchain. Being a new player in the market, the wallet has quickly gained popularity among crypto enthusiasts. But what makes it stand out from the rest?

In this Argent wallet review, we explore the features, benefits, and drawbacks of the wallet, which may help you decide if it is the right choice.

What is Argent Wallet?

Argent Wallet is a leading Ethereum-based cryptocurrency wallet that launched in 2020. During the time, the wallet was only meant to be a layer one wallet. However, From that time, the demand for Ethereum has grown, and gas fees on the protocol skyrocketed. The team behind the wallet developed a faster, more scalable version, Argent Wallet Layer 2.

The updated version is not a substitute for the Layer 1 counterpart but includes a broader range of benefits. The Layer 1 option remains the wallet’s main settlement layer.

The wallet is available as a mobile app for iOS and Android. It allows you to store, send, earn interest, and invest within the wallet. It also brings in a unique functionality that assists in making decentralized apps (dApps).

The Argent Wallet is decentralized, and only you can access your assets, and nobody has the power to stop you from accessing them.

Pros

Gives multiple layers of security compared to other crypto wallets.

It supports tricky wallets and enables easy recovery.

The wallet gives returns as interest on the assets lent by users through DeFi.

Has a low gas fee.

Cons

Smart contract clashes when liquid staking ETH.

Centralized infrastructure even though it is a decentralized hot wallet.

The indirect process of storing WBT can be challenging for new users.

How Does Argent Work?

To use Argent Wallet, you must download the mobile app on your iOS or Android smartphone. As the wallet is built on the Ethereum blockchain, your assets are stored, and you control them through the Argent app.

You have complete control over your wallet as you hold the private keys. Argent cannot access your assets or stop you from accessing them. You can also use the funds for other actions like transactions with external dApps.

Argent Wallet Key Features

Argent has some outstanding features. Such custom traits are mainly designed to ensure that you get maximum wallet benefits.

ETH Staking

Argent offers a lucrative Ethereum staking on the Ethereum chain after the merge and cross-chain on leading Layer 1 blockchains like Solana, Polkadot, Terra, and Polygon.

Argent has also integrated Lido Finance as one of its DeFi applications to achieve the requisite staking capabilities. Lido is a central liquid staking platform popular among enthusiasts. Stakers can commit their assets to the platform for profit, and then Lido generates derivative tokens.

Security

Like all crypto wallets, protecting your assets should be your number one concern. Argent operates as one of the most secure wallets. As a non-custodial DeFi wallet, only you can access and control your crypto assets, not even Argent. The platform implements some of the best security features targeted at transfer protection.

Argent implements multi-sig protection, where you can select guardian accounts. There is also a seed-phrase-free wallet recovery. In this way, when you lose the credential to your wallet, you can quickly regain access without seed phrases. The wallet also implements wallet locking, where a guardian can prevent your wallet from making transactions.

Profits from Liquidity Generation

Argent allows for the presence of good liquidity pools. For instance, the USDC/DAI liquidity pool generates about 2.5% of revenue for its liquidity providers. However, it is crucial to note that Argent is more lucrative using the Balancer integration.

Argent Wallet Fees

At its launch, Argent intended to provide fee-free transactions. However, the increase in gas fees made it no longer feasible for them to do so. Argent only charges a 0.5% commission per transaction. The commission is paid in ETH.

Besides that, you may incur the network’s gas fee, which entirely goes to the Ethereum blockchain, facilitating transactions. Gas fees fluctuate based on network congestion. Argent is, however, affordable as it has reduced congestion due to its high transaction processing speeds.

Supported Cryptocurrencies and DApps

The Argent wallet is built on the Ethereum blockchain and is focused on Ethereum. You can access over 240 different Ethereum-based (ERC20) tokens in Argent. Such tokens include ETH, DAI, MKR, LINK, USDT, UNI, and WBTC.

Additionally, the wallet paves the way to access the most popular DeFi dApps from within your wallet. You can easily earn interest by providing liquidity for loans and exchanges with Compound, DAI savings, AAVE, and PoolTogether.

How to Install Argent Wallet Extension on Your Computer

1: Head over to the Chrome browser Argent Wallet extension and click the Add to Chrome button.

Step 2: Click Add Extension on the pop-up button, which allows Chrome to download the extension.

Step 3: Once the downloads s complete, you will be redirected to an Argent X tab with the options to either Create a new wallet or Restore an existing one. Create the new wallet option.

Step 4: Read the disclaimer, check the boxes next to them, and click Continue to proceed.

Step 5: Enter your password, reconfirm it, and click Create Wallet. Finish the process.

Final Thoughts

Argent is a wallet with high potential and comprises a unique combination of functionalities that can be utilized by a vast range of users from varying blockchains. For any user who only deals with the Ethereum blockchain, Argent would be an easy recommendation for those who are okay with maintaining a separate wallet for their Ethereum-based assets.

The only drawback of its functionalities is that it only supports tokens built on the Ethereum blockchain. There is also no desktop app for Argent, only an extension.

FAQs

Is Argent Wallet free?

You do not need to pay a dime to use the Argent wallet.

Is Argent Wallet safe?

Argent Wallet operates as one of the safest software crypto wallets on the market. The wallet is self-custodial and implements more security features like multi-sig, seed-phrase-free wallet recovery, and wallet locking. Such measures prevent unauthorized asset transfers.

title: How to qualify for the Scroll airdrop - The Cryptonomist
content:
In this guide, let’s look at all the steps you need to take to qualify for Scroll’s long-awaited airdrop.

The layer 2 network, currently still in testing, will be launched in 2 months and could reward one’s community with gift tokens.

Full details below.

What is Scroll?

Scroll is an Ethereum-based layer 2 zkEVM, under development since 2021, that will most likely release an airdrop to early users in its ecosystem.

It is currently still in testnet, but it is estimated that in August there will finally be a mainnet launch, which will likely decree the need to launch a native network token, which is still absent.

The team behind the new layer 2 has raised 80 million in funding from some Venture Capitalists such as PolyChain and Sequoia, so it seems feasible that some of this money could be used for various marketing strategies including an airdrop.

Usually investments from external companies in ecosystems where there is no token (and on which there would be a need) is a signal warning of potential cryptocurrency reward airdrops.

Since February, Scroll has landed on the Test Goerli Ethereum network, attracting much attention from the users of Vitalik Buterin‘s blockchain.

Should a token actually be developed (it is very likely, but not 100% sure) those who will use the blockchain in its testing phase, performing various on-chain actions, could be rewarded with a 3-zero airdrop.

In terms of the technical features of this network, it is worth mentioning what Scroll focuses on.

First, the network focuses heavily on the scalability concept, processing much of the off-chain transitions thanks to the computational proofs inherent in zk.

High throughput plays a major role in ensuring much faster operations than those performed by the main Ethereum substrate.

In addition, the “EVM compatibility” factor means that all developers using solidity in the main DeFi industry network can easily deploy their work on Scroll.

Finally, the security feature covers a key role in the vision of the Layer 2, which is subjected to several third-party checks to avoid unpleasant mishaps such as hacks or exploits that are unfortunately commonplace in the Web3 world.

Airdrop Scroll: bridge from Ethereum

The first activity worth focusing on to try to get Scroll airdrop is to bridge funds from the Goerli Ethereum test network to the layer 2 network.

Of course, all of these steps are free, as the network has not yet landed on the mainnet, so why not give it a try?

First it is necessary to go to the official website dedicated to the alpha testnet of Scroll, and connect a MetaMask wallet to the decentralized application.

Once the wallet is connected, you will need to add Goerli Testnet and Scroll Testnet by simply clicking on the “add to metamask” items and approving transactions for free in the pop-up that will appear on your extension.

Once you have performed this step it will be mandatory to get hold of some GETH tokens (Goerli ETH).

The easiest way to obtain these test cryptocurrencies for free is to use the faucets on the web.

We recently presented a guide to the Mantle airdrop where it was explained how to do this.

In any case, if you don’t want to waste your time, try the various links on this google document.

You will only need to get a few fractions of GETH to continue with the next steps.

Among these, a key step involves bridging tokens to the Scroll network, which has to be done in this section.

After bridging the tokens and obtaining the equivalent in ETH on the Scroll network, we will already be halfway done.

It is worth noting how repeating these moves several times over the next two months will be critical to increasing your chances of getting the airdrop.

Sometimes crypto projects that aim to reward the community with tokens, assessing the repetition of actions over several days, discard casual users.

So don’t be lazy and do as many transactions as possible!

How to become eligible for the Scroll airdrop: testing the protocols in the testnet

The last steps to perform, as in any self-respecting airdrop guide, involve exploring the decentralized protocols built on the Scroll network.

The layer 2 already hosts some very well-known dApps in the Web3 landscape, such as Aave, Orbiter Finance and Syncswap.

The goal is to perform as many transactions as possible between now and the next 2 months (as these are free) by going to prove from an on-chain activity point of view that they are regular users.

The first dApp to interact with is Syncswap, the DEX of reference for the ZkSync Era network, which has recently integrated the alpha testnet of Scroll.

Perform a few swaps between ETH, USDC, WETH and USDT remembering to always leave a few fractions of ETH in the wallet to pay the gas fee, or you will have to repeat the faucet procedure on the Goerli and bridging the tokens again.

The price feeds may be off as the network is still being tested, so do not be alarmed if you can swap 0.2 ETH with over 3 million USDC, as shown in the image

The second dApp on which to play around a bit is Aave, the main borrowing/lending platform for the entire DeFi sector.

The first thing to do is to enable “testnet mode” in the settings in the upper right corner, and select the alpha Scroll network.

Next, to simplify the whole process, click on “faucet” and request all the tokens in the platform, approving the transaction from your wallet.

The more types of tokens you have in your wallet the more transactions you can perform on the platform, maximizing the potential gain from the airdrop

Once this is done you can perform a long series of transactions, such as providing tokens in liquidity, borrowing assets, repaying debt, etc.

The operation is quite simple: in order to borrow assets you must first have provided something in liquidity (supply).

On Aave there is an interest rate to be paid in the case of borrowing or received in the case of providing liquidity, which varies according to the type of token.

After supplying one asset as liquidity and borrowing another, you can repay the debt by clicking on “repay,” thus taking back the funds put up as collateral.

Remember that in case you are trading on the mainnet, if you put a volatile asset into supply to take a debt, you risk being liquidated if the value of the collateral falls below the value of the amount borrowed.

Take advantage of the fact that the tokens are all test tokens in order to familiarize yourself with Aave if you have never used it, so that you will be ready to use it should you need it in reality

Finally, use Orbiter Finance (rinkeby version) to bridge more ETH from the Ethereum Goerli network to the Scroll Testnet, performing the same procedures listed in the previous paragraph.

Wait for the launch of the network mainnet to use real funds, increasing even more the likelihood of being eligible for the airdrop.

We do not yet know when tokens will actually be distributed as rewards for actions performed to the community, in the meantime, better not to waste time!

We look forward to more information from the Scroll team.
